title: How to Enable the Ask Feature in Tumblr + Responding & Fixes

steps.title: Open the Tumblr app.
steps.content: Open the Tumblr app. This looks like a white t with a dark blue background. If you aren't already logged into your Tumblr account , do so now.

steps.title: Tap the profile icon.
steps.content: Tap the profile icon. This is the person icon at the bottom-right corner of the screen. If you aren't already on the blog you want to edit, tap the name at the top and select a new one. [1] X Research source If you have more than one blog , you’ll need to enable the Ask feature on each blog separately.

steps.title: Tap the cog icon.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon. You can find this in the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Toggle on "Let people ask questions".
steps.content: Toggle on "Let people ask questions". This is towards the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Edit your Asks (optional).
steps.content: Edit your Asks (optional). Once you enable the Ask feature, you'll see a few new options appear. Allow anonymous questions : Toggle on this option if you want to allow readers to ask questions anonymously. Otherwise, only people logged into a Tumblr account can send you Asks. Allow asks with media : Toggle on this option if you want to allow users to send you Asks with images, GIFs, and other media. Ask page title : Tap this option to change the title of the Ask title that appears on your profile. When you're finished, tap Save .

steps.title: View the Ask section on your blog.
steps.content: View the Ask section on your blog. To find your Ask box, navigate to your profile page. Tap the Ask page link in your bio. This will be Ask me anything by default or the custom text you added in the previous step. To share a link to your Ask box, use the URL: https://www.tumblr.com/new/ask/blogname . Replace blogname with your blog's name. If you don't see the Ask link, see the troubleshooting section.

steps.title: Log into https://www.tumblr.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Log into https://www.tumblr.com in a web browser. If you aren't already logged into your Tumblr account, do so now. You should see your dashboard.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You can find this in the left panel, underneath Account .

steps.title: Click the blog you want to update.
steps.content: Click the blog you want to update. If you have more than one blog on your account, you see them on the right side of the screen, underneath Blogs . If you have more than one blog, you’ll need to enable the Ask feature on each blog separately.

steps.title: Toggle on "Ask".
steps.content: Toggle on "Ask". This is in the center of the page. You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Edit your Asks (optional).
steps.content: Edit your Asks (optional). Once you enable the Ask feature, you'll see a few new options appear. If you want to allow readers to ask questions anonymously, toggle on Allow anonymous questions . Otherwise, only people logged into a Tumblr account can send you Asks. To change the Ask page title , click the field and delete the current text. Enter a new title. Allow asks with media : Toggle on this option if you want to allow users to send you Asks with images, GIFs, and other media.

steps.title: View the Ask section on your blog.
steps.content: View the Ask section on your blog. To find your Ask box, navigate to your profile page. Click the Ask page link in your bio. This will be Ask me anything by default or the custom text you added in the previous step. To share a link to your Ask box, use the URL: https://www.tumblr.com/new/ask/blogname . Replace blogname with your blog's name. If you don't see the Ask link, see the troubleshooting section.

steps.title: Tap the profile icon.
steps.content: Tap the profile icon. This is in the bottom-right corner. If you get Tumblr notifications, you can tap it to be redirected to the Ask box. You can also tap the Activity tab (speech bubble with smiley face) to quickly see any new Asks.

steps.title: Tap the cog icon.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon. This is in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Inbox.
steps.content: Tap Inbox . You can find this underneath Queue . Your inbox will open with all current Asks and submissions.

steps.title: Tap Answer.
steps.content: Tap Answer . This is at the bottom of the Ask you want to respond to. If you want to delete an Ask, tap the trashcan icon instead.

steps.title: Type your response.
steps.content: Type your response. You can include all the formatting of a regular post, such as font type, size, lists, links, images, and more. To edit your Asks settings, tap ••• in the top-right corner and choose to schedule the post, save as a draft, prevent others from reblogging, and more.

steps.title: Tap Post.
steps.content: Tap Post . If you want to answer the post privately, tap ••• in the top-right corner and select Answer privately . This option is only visible if the user is signed into a Tumblr account. The Ask will be published on your profile. If sent privately, the Ask will appear in the user's inbox.

steps.title: Click Inbox.
steps.content: Click Inbox . This is in the left panel. If you have new Asks or submissions, you'll see a number to the right of it.

steps.title: Click Answer.
steps.content: Click Answer . This is at the bottom of the Ask you want to respond to. If you want to delete an Ask, click the trashcan icon instead.

steps.title: Type your response.
steps.content: Type your response. You can include all the formatting of a regular post, such as font type, size, lists, links, images, and more. To edit your Asks settings, click the cog icon in the top-right corner and choose to schedule the post, save as a draft, prevent others from reblogging, and more.

steps.title: Click Post now.
steps.content: Click Post now . If you want to answer the post privately, click the down arrow next to Post now and select Answer privately . This option is only visible if the user is signed into a Tumblr account. The Ask will be published on your profile. If sent privately, the Ask will appear in the user's inbox.

steps.title: I can't see my Ask link.
steps.content: I can't see my Ask link. If you've enabled the Ask feature but you don't see the button or link on your profile, you can manually add the link to your blog. Do the following: Select Settings and select your blog. Select Edit theme . In the description, enter the code: Ask me a question! Select Save , and then Exit .

steps.title: I can't send any Asks.
steps.content: I can't send any Asks. If you can't send any Asks to users, you may have passed the Ask limit. Currently, you can only submit 10 Asks per hour, and only 5 can be sent anonymously.

steps.title: My Asks aren't being received by the user.
steps.content: My Asks aren't being received by the user. Asks may be blocked due to a variety of reasons: You have sent over 10 Asks in the past hour. The Asks included links, paragraph breaks, special characters, emoticons, ellipses, or no spaces. The Ask is longer than 500 characters. The user has blocked your network location.

steps.title: My inbox notification count is wrong.
steps.content: My inbox notification count is wrong. This can happen if you received an Ask or message from a bot or an account that's been recently terminated. This is currently a known issue, and Tumblr is attempting to resolve it as quickly as possible. [2] X Research source

steps.title: An Ask acts as a one-way message to a user.
steps.content: An Ask acts as a one-way message to a user. This Ask can be answered publicly or privately by the user. Most users use Asks as a Q&A conversation with another user. For example, someone can leave an Ask in a user's inbox with a question or comment. The user can then answer the question or respond to the feedback. If the user responds privately, the Ask will be sent back along with the response. If the user responds publicly, the Ask will be published on their profile as a public post. Public Asks can be reblogged and liked, similar to other posts. If the Ask is sent by an Anonymous user, it can only be responded to publicly.
